verbs.description: untwine (third-person singular simple present untwines, present participle untwining, simple past and past participle untwined)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To untwist the strands of (something entwined).
examples: The rope must be then untwined and the middle of each strand laid across the top and stitched down along the pencil line, half the length falling on one side, half on the other.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To free (one thing that is entwined with another), disentangle, extricate.
examples: Woe to the revolutionist who is not himself a creature of the revolution! If he anticipate, he is lost; for it requires, what no individual can supply, a long and powerful counter-sympathy in a nation to untwine the ties of custom which bind a people to the established and the old.
As the tangled mass of men untwined, following the blast of the whistle, Sage heard Stone calling in his ear  […]
